page.title: 16RECREATION IN BERKELEY VALE
page.content: The{Little Avon}is a popular{fishing area with many species of fish to be caught. It flows into the{River Severn via{Berkeley Pill}by the{Power Station where fishing is best due to there being less weeds, deeper and faster flowing water. The{Playing Park}is widely used for a number of{different activities.}The top end has swings, slides and climbing frames and there is a large space at the bottom end. The local {cubs and scouts}make full use of these facilities as their hut is just opposite. A mini{BMX track}built by local youngsters is very popular, as is{cycling}in general due to the low traffic and plentiful country lanes. Other{outdoor}activities include the game of{'arrow-tag'}(following arrows drawn on the pavement),{football}and other sport tournaments.
